description: Primary identifier for the asset record within the system.
Standardized category of asset (e.g., vehicle, trailer, equipment) used for reporting and workflows.
Finer classification code within the asset type; organization-specific code; confirm with SME.
Human-readable description of the asset, typically year, make, model, and configuration.
Alternate asset identifier (e.g., unit number or legacy tag); confirm with SME.
Barcode or tag number used for scanning and inventory tracking; confirm with SME.
Identifier of the parent asset in the asset hierarchy (host asset or assembly).
Type/category of the parent asset associated with this asset.
Hierarchy level of this asset within its asset tree (root/top = 1).
Link to a network/location node associated with the asset; likely GIS or network reference; confirm with SME.
Second network/location node associated with the asset; likely used for linear assets; confirm with SME.
Type/classification of node1; defines what the first node represents; confirm with SME.
Type/classification of node2; defines what the second node represents; confirm with SME.
Owning organization, department, or external entity responsible for the asset; confirm with SME.
Indicates whether the asset is maintained by the organization (Y/N).
Free-text notes about the asset’s history, status, or comments.
Prominent warning or caution message shown with the asset; confirm with SME.
Shop, vendor, or team responsible for maintaining the asset.
Financial cost center to which asset-related costs are charged.
General ledger or accounting account associated with the asset.
Start date of the asset’s warranty coverage.
Date to notify of impending warranty expiration; reminder threshold.
End date of the asset’s warranty coverage.
Indicates metrology/calibration requirement or status for the asset; confirm with SME.
Minimum expected fuel economy for applicable assets; used for monitoring exceptions.
Maximum expected fuel economy for applicable assets; used for performance benchmarking.
Internal key referencing a standardized address record; confirm with SME.
Street block number for the asset’s location; confirm with SME.
Street name for the asset’s location.
Primary street address for the asset’s location.
Secondary address line (e.g., suite, unit).
City for the asset’s address.
State or province for the asset’s address.
Nearest cross street reference for location; confirm with SME.
Postal/ZIP code for the asset’s address.
Country code for the asset’s address (ISO or organization standard).
Parcel identifier for property-related assets; confirm with SME.
Tract or subdivision number tied to the asset’s location; confirm with SME.
Short reference or landmark for quickly locating the asset.
Neighborhood or community area for location grouping; confirm with SME.
Governing jurisdiction or service area where the asset resides.
Map or grid reference identifier for locating the asset; confirm with SME.
Indicates whether the asset lies within an easement (Y/N).
Projected X coordinate (e.g., Easting) of the asset’s location; confirm coordinate system with SME.
Projected Y coordinate (e.g., Northing) of the asset’s location; confirm coordinate system with SME.
Elevation (Z) in the projected coordinate system; confirm units with SME.
Longitude of the asset’s location (decimal degrees).
Latitude of the asset’s location (decimal degrees).
Altitude/elevation of the asset’s location; units may vary; confirm with SME.
Access restrictions or instructions for reaching the asset.
Manufacturer-assigned product or model identifier; confirm with SME.
Manufacturer model designation for the asset.
Manufacturer serial number uniquely identifying the unit.
Brand or manufacturer name of the asset.
Engineering plan or drawing number associated with the asset.
As-built drawing/document number for the installed asset configuration.
Coded representation of asset size/dimension class; confirm with SME.
Text description of the asset’s size or configuration.
Diameter dimension of the asset or component; include units; confirm with SME.
Color of the asset; used for identification; confirm with SME.
Shape or form factor descriptor; confirm with SME.
Volume capacity or physical volume; include units; confirm with SME.
Surface area or footprint; include units; confirm with SME.
Weight or mass of the asset; include units.
Length dimension; include units.
Depth or thickness dimension; include units.
Primary material composition of the asset.
Construction or manufacturing method used; confirm with SME.
Numeric or categorical rating (e.g., condition, capacity) based on rating_type; confirm with SME.
Defines the rating scale or context for rating_value (e.g., condition, risk).
Estimated likelihood of asset failure within a defined period; used in risk assessment.
Impact/severity if the asset fails; used in risk assessment.
Criticality score or class indicating importance to operations or safety.
Expected service life of the asset in years.
Current age of the asset in years (derived or stored).
Estimated remaining service life in years.
Date the asset was manufactured or constructed.
Flags if this record represents a system/assembly rather than a single unit; confirm with SME.
Date of last major rebuild or overhaul.
Estimated cost to replace the asset with a like-for-like unit.
Date the asset was purchased or acquired.
Date the asset was installed or commissioned at its location.
Date the asset was sold or disposed.
Original acquisition or capitalized value of the asset.
Estimated residual value at end of service life.
Number of accounting periods used for depreciation; confirm method with SME.
Current depreciation period or fiscal period index; confirm with SME.
Generic user-defined field; purpose varies by implementation; confirm with SME.
User-defined text field for client-specific data.
User-defined text field for client-specific data.
User-defined text field for client-specific data.
User-defined text field, often used for budget or funding notes; confirm with SME.

User-defined numeric field for client-specific metrics or codes.

User-defined numeric field for client-specific metrics or codes.
Identifier of the customer/organization the asset is assigned to; confirm with SME.
Reference or URL to related permit documentation.
Primary contact person’s name for the asset.
Primary phone number for the primary contact.
Email address for the primary contact.
Additional text or notes about the primary contact.
Secondary contact person’s name for the asset.
Primary phone number for the secondary contact.
Email address for the secondary contact.
Additional text or notes about the secondary contact.
Mailing address line 1 for correspondence related to the asset.
Mailing address line 2 for correspondence related to the asset.
City for the mailing address.
State/province for the mailing address.
Postal/ZIP code for the mailing address.
Country for the mailing address.
Short code for the asset’s assigned location, division, or shop.
User or process that created the record.
Timestamp when the record was created.
User who last updated the record.
Timestamp of the last update to the record.
Route identifier if the asset is part of a service or inspection route; confirm with SME.
Current GIS geometry (point/line/polygon) representing the asset’s location.
Original GIS geometry as imported or surveyed, retained for reference.
Fax number for the primary contact; confirm usage with SME.
Current book or fair value of the asset; confirm valuation method with SME.
Operational district or service area to which the asset belongs.
Project identifier associated with the asset’s acquisition or deployment.
Width dimension; include units.
Height dimension; include units.
Condition status or rating of the asset.
Horsepower rating for engines/equipment; include units if needed.
License or plate number assigned to the asset.
Vehicle Identification Number or serial identifier for vehicles.
Sub-location identifier (e.g., bay, stall, room) where the asset resides.
Indicates cost-sharing arrangement or percentage between entities; confirm with SME.
Internal link key to attachments or component associations; confirm with SME.
Redundancy designation (e.g., N+1) indicating backup capability; confirm with SME.
Asset management grouping for maintenance, reporting, or permissions; confirm with SME.
Primary meter basis for usage (e.g., miles, hours).
Foreign key to GIS feature/object representing the asset.
Percentage of useful life consumed based on age or condition.
Estimated cost of downtime for this asset; confirm calculation with SME.
Standard labor hours associated with routine maintenance or tasks; confirm with SME.
Indicates whether the first accounting/depreciation posting has been processed; confirm with SME.
Model year of the asset (typically vehicles/equipment).
Manufacturer or make of the asset.
Primary fuel type used by the asset (e.g., gasoline, diesel, electric).
Indicates if the asset has autopilot or autonomous capability; confirm with SME.
Sub-status detailing availability or operational state (e.g., Available, Out-of-service).
Reference to a 3D/visualization file (e.g., SVF) linked to the asset; confirm with SME.
Object identifier within the visualization/model file; confirm with SME.
Indicates if the asset is active and in use (Y/N).

User or person who verified the asset information.
Date the asset information was verified.
Linkage to preventive maintenance program or templates; confirm with SME.
Identifier for the department owning or using the asset.
Identifier used by the mobile application for this asset; confirm with SME.
Drive configuration code (e.g., FWD, RWD, 4WD); coding scheme may be abbreviated; confirm with SME.

Capacity of the secondary fuel tank; include units.
Fuel type for the primary fuel system/tank.

Engine oil capacity; include units.
Priority level for maintenance/operations associated with the asset.
Primary/front tire size specification.

Transmission type or gear specification; may include model codes.
Date the asset entered service.
Date the asset was removed from service.
Gross Vehicle Weight Rating for vehicles; confirm units.
Method or formula used to calculate depreciation for this asset; confirm with SME.
Concatenated representation of the asset’s hierarchy path (parents and types).
Indicates whether the asset has child components (e.g., root/leaf).
Count of immediate child assets linked to this asset.
Indicates whether this asset uses geometry inherited from its parent; confirm with SME.
Assigned parking lot or storage area for the asset.
Flag indicating whether the asset is represented in GIS; confirm with SME.
